thread.title: Clinton, O'Malley, Sanders to headline Southern forum
thread.title_full: Clinton, O'Malley, Sanders to headline Southern forum

author: The Associated Press
title: Clinton, O'Malley, Sanders to headline Southern forum
text:
Saturday October 10th, 2015 11:22AM Posted 1:07PM on Friday 9th October 2015 ( 22 hours ago ) Clinton, O'Malley, Sanders to headline Southern forum By The Associated Press Related Articles Sanders seeks black support in Ga., elsewhere in the South Union Co. FD mourns loss of pilot in Pickens Co. crash SCOGA to hear challenge by college students who are not U.S. citizens; court to meet in Ellijay Fire damages southside Gainesville residence 
ATLANTA - Three Democratic presidential candidates are scheduled to attend a Nov. 6 forum in South Carolina. 
The nationally televised event at Winthrop University isn't a debate. Instead, MSNBC host Rachel Maddow will conduct separate conversations with former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley and Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders. 
The forum is sponsored by 12 state Democratic parties stretching from Virginia to Texas, along with the Democratic National Committee and South Carolina Congressman James Clyburn. 
The South will play a key role in choosing a nominee. South Carolina's primary is Feb. 27. Many other Southern states follow in March. 
Party officials said all Democratic hopefuls were invited to Winthrop. They say Vice President Joe Biden would receive an invitation if he joins the race before Nov. 6. Associated Categories : Homepage , Politics Associated Tags : presidential campaign, Southern primaries Â© Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
